nodes.bodyText: Did common already merge to dev? Can we change this to point to SNAPSHOT version?

Common doesn't need to merge to dev for this release, because it is already ahead of this release (we have already deployed 2.0.13, this release shipped 2.0.12-hf1 which doesn't contain all of those changes)
(This is to say, there shouldn't be any more 2.0.12-hf1 snapshots unless I am missing something?)
Yup, there wont be any  2.0.12-hf1 snapshots since common dev is at 2.0.14 - so we can change to 2.0.14-SNAPSHOT  for the nightly builds here

I am fine either ways, typically we update this when doing an MSAL release (i.e. we always have a newest common). This is weird case with hotfix.

We can leave it at 2.0.12-hf1 as it's the latest common MSAL is consuming in maven central or
Given it's dev branch and we updating it with latest common makes sense too.

@shahzaibj @kreedula Let's go ahead and rev this version to 2.0.14-SNAPSHOT and 2.0.14 respectively. Even still, this state will be short-lived, as these will both be updated to 2.0.15 next week for the regularly scheduled release of 1.5.6 (or 1.6.0, depending on the contents of changes)
